stream_context.summary: Kaze integrates a new profiler, optimizes Course 13 (snow-themed slide) and imports Biobak’s updated “Oily Boily Bay” assets while discussing performance, memory and upcoming overworld work.

development_findings.summary: A new combined trace/profiler by Sauraen was integrated, exposing that roughly 76 % of each frame is spent in an idle loop and that the game is currently RSP-bottlenecked.
development_findings.quote: 25 out of 33 milliseconds are spent on a while 1 loop… around 76 % of the entire game, it's just the game doing nothing at all.

development_findings.summary: Running out of memory while building the Course 13 slide led Kaze to rewrite the surface-node allocator, reclaiming roughly 400 µs of frame time.
development_findings.quote: When I first made this slide I ran out of memory… because of that we gained 400 microseconds of computing time.

development_findings.summary: Trigonometric lookup tables were replaced with polynomial approximations, improving speed and increasing directional precision from 4 096 to 65 536 discrete angles.
development_findings.quote: I had to switch to a polynomial… it increased the accuracy a lot as well.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 design: a snowman cave, helix slide over an abyss, ice-block surfing and a wall-kick exit; difficulty tuned by scaling the slide and adjusting camera rather than tilting it.
Biobak’s latest “Oily Boily Bay” pass reduces materials, bones and textures (e.g., new wamps, tox boxes, Koopas) and, with fog tweaks, allows the level to hit 30 FPS on console.
development_findings.quote: Dang, I think we can get Oily Boily Bay at 30 FPS now.

development_findings.summary: Updated step-function and collision normals caused some objects (tox boxes, thwomps) to clip; Kaze begins debugging and considers exceptions for bumpy slopes.
Wiggler now uses three facial states, new path logic and corrected turning behaviour after bug-fixing ‘trajectory end’ logic.
Zeina has started modelling a new overworld; Kaze evaluates her early assets alongside level work.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is on two months of paternity leave but plans to spend much of it optimising the N64 engine.
context_findings.quote: I'm still on two months of paternity leave. I'm gonna spend that time trying to optimize the operating system on my N64.

context_findings.summary: He and Zeina are expecting a daughter named Raina; playful references to ‘Raina vs Zeina’ rivalries appear on-stream.
context_findings.quote: The child's gonna be called Raina… and then I'm gonna have Raina and Zeina fight to the death.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses dissatisfaction with German bureaucracy, taxes and technology, noting he has moved out of Germany.
context_findings.quote: Living in Germany sucks. I'm so glad I moved out.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on optimisation: memory bandwidth & latency are major bottlenecks; ‘Rambus goes vroom vroom’ became a motif out of frustration at repeating technical explanations.
Emotional tone fluctuates between excitement over new tools, frustration with rendering bugs, and humour about memes and physics.

biobak.summary: Provided large asset drop for Oily Boily Bay: fewer materials, fog-ready textures, redesigned wamps, tox boxes, Koopas, thwomps and glass elements to cut polygons and draw calls.
biobak.quote: Goal: new design and one fewer material. That is the notes that Biobak left us, which is very good because fewer materials is good.

biobak.summary: Helped diagnose clipping and material issues live; requested colour-guessing ‘Color Rush’ mini-game to loosen the stream.

zeina.summary: Is producing 3D models for a new overworld and shares them with Kaze for review.
zeina.quote: The thing I was working on for the new overwalt… Zeina is making a bunch of 3D models and stuff; Zeina wanted to give making the new overwalt a try.

key_stories.title: Slide Crash & Memory Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: A large slide in Course 13 exhausted Mario 64’s collision-node memory, crashing the game. Kaze rewrote the allocator, reclaimed 400 µs, and refined the slide’s design.
key_stories.challenge: Slide’s collision triangles crossed many spatial cells, exceeding surface-node limits and causing a crash.
key_stories.process: Investigated profiler, rewrote memory allocation, scaled slide geometry and camera to ease difficulty.
key_stories.outcome: Stable build with performance gain; slide remains challenging but fair.
key_stories.key_quote: I ran out of memory… we gained 400 microseconds of computing time.

key_stories.title: Profiler Revelation
key_stories.summary: Sauraen’s new profiler exposed that most frame time was idle and that RSP tasks gate performance, reshaping optimisation priorities.
key_stories.challenge: Unclear where frame time was being spent.
key_stories.process: Integrated profiler, limited FPS to visualise thread timeline, interpreted coloured bars.
key_stories.outcome: Identified severe idle time and RSP bottleneck; Kaze plans further low-level optimisation.
key_stories.key_quote: 25 out of 33 milliseconds are spent on a while 1 loop.

key_stories.title: Asset Pass to 30 FPS
key_stories.summary: Biobak’s material and bone reductions transformed Oily Boily Bay from lag-prone to a solid 30 FPS level on console.
key_stories.challenge: Level complexity dragged performance below target framerate.
key_stories.process: Biobak simplified textures, merged materials, removed bones; Kaze integrated, adjusted fog and shaders.
key_stories.outcome: Consistent 30 FPS expected; visual style improved.
key_stories.key_quote: Dang, I think we can get Oily Boily Bay at 30 FPS now.

key_stories.title: Developer & Dad
key_stories.summary: With daughter Raina due any day, Kaze balances impending fatherhood with obsession over optimisation, joking about using leave for N64 coding.
key_stories.challenge: Paternity leave traditionally used for childcare, not deep technical work.
key_stories.process: Streams continue; jokes with chat and Zeina; acknowledges schedule juggling.
key_stories.outcome: Leave will be divided between family and engine work; emotional but humorous attitude.
key_stories.key_quote: What the fuck do you want me to do with my free time?

open_questions.context: Profiler shows 76 % idle and RSP tasks exceeding RDP.
questions: What specific tasks are blocking the main loop?
What is the roadmap to shift work off the RSP or parallelise better?
Could game logic run during idle cycles?

open_questions.context: Allocator fix gained 400 µs but details were brief.
questions: How does the new allocator differ architecturally from the vanilla SM64 one?
Any risks of fragmentation or future limits?
Could this be generalised for community use?

open_questions.context: Lookup tables replaced by polynomials; accuracy & speed both rose.
questions: What specific polynomial approximation was chosen?
Any edge-case errors or gameplay impacts?
How portable is this to other N64 projects?

open_questions.context: Zeina is modelling a new overworld but only screenshots were shown.
questions: What vision guides the new overworld layout?
How do Zeina and Kaze iterate and critique each other’s work?
Will the new hub change course progression or story?

open_questions.context: Level now aims for 30 FPS with asset reductions.
questions: What concrete metrics improved (triangles, materials, commands)?
Any gameplay compromises for performance?
How is performance validated on real hardware?

open_questions.context: Kaze jokes about coding during paternity leave.
questions: How will newborn care reshape the development schedule?
What tasks are delegated during his reduced availability?
How does the team support each other during life events?

open_questions.context: New step function causes tox box clipping.
questions: What changed in the step algorithm?
How widespread are the collision regressions?
Is there a testing pipeline for physics changes?
